page.title: 16Local History
page.content: Dupplin Castle lies to the north east of Forteviot village. It was rebuilt in 1967. The previous castle was built between 1828 _1830. The part known as the Stirling wing was built in 1740. During W.W.2 the house, as the family like to call it, was damaged by fire while being used as a hospital for Polish soldiers. The new castle was built because the old one was too big and the sandstone was in a bad state of repair, along with the roof. Dupplin Castle's estate covers 1100 acres. Before the war it employed 11 gamekeepers and 20 household staff.Now there are 5 domestics and 1 gardener. There are 16 employees on the farms, 6 forestry workers, 6 gamekeepers, 3 tradesmen and estate office workers. The estate belongs to a trust and the Laird is only a tenant.
